title: Graph of equation for electric field

content.question: Which of the following graphs depicts the equation <math alttext="E as a function of t, equals, 200 newtons per coulomb, times cosine, open parenthesis, 4 pi times t, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>200</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the electric field strength at time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of a wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 1.0, in increments of 0.2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Electric Field, in newtons per coulomb,” and the numbers negative 200 through 200, in increments of 100, are indicated. Note that all values are approximate. The wave begins at the coordinate 0.0 seconds comma 200 newtons per coulomb, and ends at the coordinate 1.0 second comma 200 newtons per coulomb. The wave reaches a maximum, at a wave trough at 0.5  comma negative 200.

The figure presents a diagram of a wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 1.0, in increments of 0.2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Electric Field, in newtons per coulomb,” and numbers negative 200 through 200, in increments of 100, are indicated. Note that all values are approximate. The wave begins at the coordinate 0.0 seconds comma 200 newtons per coulomb, and ends at the coordinate 1.0 second comma 200 newtons per coulomb. The wave reaches a maximum at the following 3 points. A wave trough at 0.25 second comma negative 200 newtons per coulomb. A wave peak at 0.5 second comma 200 newtons per coulomb. A wave trough at 0.75 second comma negative 200 newtons per coulomb.

The wave begins at the coordinate 0.0 seconds comma 200 newtons per coulomb, and ends at the coordinate 1.0 second comma 200 newtons per coulomb. The wave reaches a maximum at the following 3 points. A wave trough at 0.25 second comma negative 200 newtons per coulomb. A wave peak at 0.5 second comma 200 newtons per coulomb. A wave trough at 0.75 second comma negative 200 newtons per coulomb.
